column4: can anyone help me connect my mac to my ubuntu desktop for file sharing??
i have tried following both smb and nfs tutorials with no success
use ssh
they are on the same internal network... all i want to do is exchange files in a shared folder... can that be done with ssh?
yes
would you happen to have a link to a turorial?  i'm really new at this... especially networking
install openssh-server and openssh-client on ubuntu
ok
i have them both installed now what?
from ubuntu, connect to a server (it's in the menu in gnome), choose ssh, type your ip address, login... and it should be ok
sounds good... but how would i connect TO ubuntu FROM my mac?
it should be ok if ssh server is activated on mac of course (don't ask me about doing that on mac, I don't know)
use a ftp application that can handle ssh too, type your ip address, login, password, and it should be ok
let me try that thank you
I meant from your mac
where do i set my ssh login/password?
in the application
in what application? open-ssh? and if so... where do i find it?
in the ftp application on mac
but i never setup a login for the ssh... is it the same as my main login for my computer?
yes it is
it worked! thank you!
cool :)
